office: Committee on Oversight and Government Reform
position: Environment Counsel or Professional Staff Member
key_responsibilities: depositions, transcribed interviews, briefings, and congressional hearings
requirements: attorney or policy professional with several years of investigative or litigation experience working on environmental issues, or with environmental regulatory agencies
superior attention to detail
work well under pressure
self-motivated
excellent written and oral communication skills

key_responsibilities: reviewing financial statements and providing legal advice on a high volume of financial disclosure issues, education and training to Members of Congress and their staff through frequent telephone calls, in-person meetings, and written work product
requirements: outstanding analytical and written and oral communication skills
sound judgment necessary to evaluate the sensitive matters that arise before the Committee
Experience in one or more of the following areas is desirable: government ethics, ethics counseling, accounting, auditing, investment management, taxation, corporate finance, and securities law

key_responsibilities: conducting investigations and adjudicatory and disciplinary proceedings regarding Members and staff of the U.S. House of Representatives
requirements: outstanding analytical and written/oral communications skills
sound judgment necessary to evaluate the sensitive matters that arise before the Committee

Experience in one or more of the following areas is desirable: government ethics; campaign finance; criminal law; employment law, including the laws governing sexual harassment in the workplace; civil litigation; administrative investigations and adjudications; depositions; and financial accounting

office: Energy & Commerce Committee, Democratic Staff, Health Subcommittee
key_responsibilities: drafting memos and preparing background materials for Members and staff
assisting other Health Subcommittee staff in preparation for hearings and markups
drafting letters
conducting background research in order to support staff in the drafting of legislation and oversight efforts
requirements: at least 3 years of health policy-related experience and be knowledgeable in health finance issues related to Medicare, Medicaid, and the Affordable Care Act, as well as public health issues related to the Food and Drug Administration (FDA), the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), and other public health agencies
strong understanding of the Committee process and procedures of the House of Representatives
ability to perform under short timelines and in a high-pressure environment while juggling competing priorities
excellent writing and analytical skills

key_responsibilities: managing and maintaining the Congressman’s DC schedule
coordinating travel
handling front office duties
assisting with office administration
requirements: highly-organized and detail-oriented
excellent oral and written communications skills
ability to multi-task and meet deadlines
positive attitude
Previous scheduling experience preferred. California ties a plus.

key_responsibilities: Track bills and maintain bill files
Markup organization, including amendment tracking and distribution; document compilation and preparation; keeping minutes; and assembling and filing legislative reports
Ensure compliance with Committee’s required submissions to House Document Repository for hearings, financial disclosures, and markups
An understanding of Committee jurisdiction and ability to assist general counsel and parliamentary team with bill referrals and reporting requirements
Maintain official voting records and rosters
Produce Committee legislative calendar and maintain official record of Committee activity
Compile and publish Compilations of Selected Acts in coordination with the House Office of the Legislative Counsel
Maintain Committee’s official letterhead, Franked envelopes and official listings with the Clerk of the House and Government Publications Office
Complete compilation and binding of Committee prints, hearings, reports, and public laws and maintain Committee’s library
Maintain, organize, and transmit official records at the end each Congress
requirements: strong organizational and communication skills
proofreading, editing, and writing ability
exceptional attention to detail
previous Congressional experience
working knowledge of the legislative process
familiarity with legislative documents including the Congressional Record
proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, Adobe Acrobat, and internet research using legislative resources

Graduation from an ABA accredited law school and active bar membership

office: House Committee on Education and Labor (Democratic staff)
position: elementary and secondary education (K-12) legislative assistant
key_responsibilities: supporting the work of the Professional Staff
supporting the development of legislation
providing technical assistance to the Committee and Member offices
researching pertinent issues
preparing written materials and legislative analyses
supporting the execution of committee proceedings and events related to K-12 education
requirements: familiarity with federal education policy, including the Elementary and Secondary Education Act, General Education Provisions Act, Carl D. Perkins Career and Technical Education Act, and the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act
knowledge of other statutes and policies within the Committee’s jurisdiction and how they impact elementary and secondary education policy
at least two years of policy or legal experience
prior Hill experience is preferred but not necessary

office: House Office of Diversity and Inclusion
key_responsibilities: leading data and research collection and analysis for the Office of Diversity and Inclusion
leading the development of the required diversity report
maintaining key metrics and key performance indicators for the Office
serving as a resource for external and internal diversity best practices

serving as the project manager for any consultants and/or contractors with whom the Office may engage to support the completion of the diversity report and to develop relevant diversity and inclusion-based training, in collaboration with the Congressional Staff Academy
assisting in the translation of research findings into materials that staff can effectively utilize in their engagements with Members and Member offices
providing research support on diversity and inclusion studies, techniques and tools
serving as project manager for the diversity report and, where necessary, directing and coordinating activities of external consultants
researching and studying best practices for retention and growth in House employing offices
leading data tracking and reporting with a focus on performance and results
preparing regular updates and briefing documents on research that is relevant to House employing offices
assisting with the development and delivery of training sessions and, as needed, conducting presentations at professional conferences and meetings
requirements: Master’s degree in social or behavioral sciences or related field; or equivalent level of experience providing technical assistance, data collections and/or research
knowledge and experience in diversity, equity, and inclusion research efforts, ideally with a strong background in curriculum development
current working knowledge of coalition functioning, evaluation and research
quantitative and qualitative evaluation and research skills
expertise using relevant software
customer-service orientation and ability to work harmoniously with a diverse team
ability to work under deadline pressure and extra hours if needed on assignment
demonstrated ability to self-motivate, initiate project activities, and work on multiple assignments simultaneously
extensive computer skills, including data input
